summary.body: Are there any other Holmes Place Barbican users experiencing the hell that the Aldersgate gym has become? This is not just because it is in renovation mode. A selection of my gripes (much abbreviated) include: Young children (in particular pre-teen girls) romping around in the  men's shower room at weekends while their Dads are in the shower cubicles....it is beyond daft, but most young men using the showers at the same time look too embarrassed to complain  Washing the changing room floor - sealing off access to lockers with the fresh change of clothes etc in it - while the gym is in full swing Cutting the sunbed time from 15 minutes to 10 minutes (for the same price)
summary.subject: The hell that is Holmes Place Barbican

summary.body: I'm looking at covering Health Clubs and Gyms in close proximity to the Barbican in the next issue of Barbican Life.  Those I'm looking at are:  Champneys, Holmes Place Barbican, Holmes Place Moorgate, Lambs Club (Fitness Exchange), LA Fitness, Fitness First and the YMCA.  Comments appreciated as long as they don't stimulate a thread like the long running one - 'The Hell that is Holmes Place'!  Interested in facilities, service, pricing etc.  Obviously I'm asking the health clubs themselves to send in photographs and details on their services, but users comments would also be appreciated and may be used anonymously.
summary.subject: Health Clubs etc.

summary.body: I discovered recently that Holmes Place Barbican has significantly reduced its off-peak hours (but of course without any corresponding reduction in its membership fee). They've also introduced a new rule that off-peak members aren't admitted more than 30min before the end of the off-peak period and need to leave before it ends - before so long as you entered within the off-peak time you could stay as long as you liked. Aside from meaning they now offer considerably worse value for money for off-peak members, this is plainly in breach of their membership conditions (which do not mention them having any right to vary off peak hours). I strongly urge any off-peak members to write to the manager, Andy Francis, and ask him to reinstate the previous rules, or at least offer a significant reduction in price.
summary.subject: Holmes Place hours change

I've resisted and they have now come in with a better offer but I'd be grateful to hear from others about what they pay, particularly if there is anyone with an ancient membership which was supposed to give a permanent discount. Also, since Holmes Place often raises my blood pressure as much as it's supposed to lower it, does anyone have strong recommendations for alternatives.  Is Champneys still hugely expensive?

summary.body: Hello, I wanted to see if any other parents are missing not being able to take their kids to the pool at the weekend.  I have complained to the management a couple of times about reinstating a lifeguard, but they say the problem is they're not able to find a lifeguard that will only work for a couple of hours a day. I think if there's enough of us that rally around and push for it, Virgin will make more of an effort to find somebody/have to increase the wage to make it more of an attractive offer.   I know we're able to use the faciltiies at the Islington site but with all the baggage, inflatables etc. it's just another hike I want to avoid at the weekend - in the time we save we might even be able to squeeze in the luxury of a few Sunday papers. Oh the crazy, glamorous life we parents lead! Here's hoping! Best, Sam
summary.subject: No Lifeguard for Children at Virgin Barbican Pool
